arm_group.description: %0.5 Lidocaine+Ketamine HCL 0.8 mg/kg, total 40ml, single dose administration, 30 minute duration, total 200mg lidocaine
% 0.5 lidocaine, 35 ml serum physiologic, 200 mg lidokaine, 30 minute single dose

brief_summary.textblock:
IVRA can be performed with many local anesthetics and adjuvant agents. In our study we
      planned to compare cardiac effects and ECG changes by IVRA with lidocaine and lidocaine plus
      ketamine.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Anesthetic Agents Management on ECG Changes of Patients Who Were Operated Under RIVA

detailed_description.textblock:
Methods: In our study patients between 18-60 years, with score of ASA 1-2 and who were
      undergoing IVRA for short operations on arm and forearm were included. Systolic, diastolic
      and mean blood pressures, heart rate, Spo2, ECG, adverse effects during the operation were
      recorded. Double cuffed tourniquet were placed on the extremity to be operated to hinder
      nerve injuries. With Esmarch bandage venous blood in the extremity was purged. Proximal cuff
      was inflated with a pressure 50-100 mmHg higher than systolic blood pressure and the bandage
      was displaced. Randomly patients were divided into 2 groups. Group 1: %0.5
      Lidocaine+Ketamine 0.8 mg/kg; 40 ml. Group 2: %0.5 Lidocaine 40 ml. Anesthetic agent was
      injected with a rate of 20 ml/min. 20 minutes after injection the distal cuff was inflated
      and the proximal cuff deflated with a rate of 50 mmHg in every 3 minutes. 0,5,10,15,30,45,60
      minutes after the beginning of deflation and 10 minutes after the deflation was completed
      ECG were recorded. PR,QT,QTc, RR were recorded.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Patients between 18-60 years

          2. ASA 1-2 physical status

          3. Undergoing IVRA for short operations on arm and forearm

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Allergy to study drugs,

          2. Serious cardiac diseases,

          3. Respiratory diseases,

          4. Renal failure,

          5. Drug addiction,

          6. Pregnancy,

          7. Liver failure,

          8. Hypertension,

          9. Genetic diseases of musculoskeletal system,

         10. Use of antiepileptic drugs, abnormal thyroid functions and operation period over 1
             hour.

intervention.description: ketamine HCL is using as adjuvant agent with local anesthetic agent in regional intravenous anesthesia procedure routinely

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Different Anesthetic Agents Management on Electrocardiographic Changes of Patients Who Were Operated Under Regional Intravenous Anesthesia

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: 0,5,10,15,30,45,60 minutes after the beginning of deflation and 10 minutes after the deflation was completed ECG were recorded. PR,QT,QTc, RR were recorded.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change QT and QTc intervals from baseline to 60 minutes

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: 0,5,10,15,30,45,60 minutes after the beginning of deflation and 10 minutes after the deflation was completed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of mean arteryel pressure from baseline to 60 minutes

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Factorial Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Prevention
